news.title: Father made video call to gardaí before body of little Daniel Aruebose found in Donabate
news.summary: Gardaí held a video call with Daniel Aruebose’s father from the wasteground where his suspected remains were found as part of their efforts to pinpoint where the little boy was buried.

news.title: TD’s car stolen by cross-border gang taking cars worth €500,000 every month
news.summary: A TD has been targeted by a cross-border car theft ring who are suspected of stealing up to €500,000 worth of vehicles every month.

news.title: Mary Regan: What now for Eoin Hayes, the man who gave up a million euro for a life of political obscurity?
news.summary: Eoin Hayes cut a forlorn political figure, sitting on the back benches of the Dáil chamber. No longer in the no man’s land of the far-back corner, between Danny Healy-Rae and the wall, he is now sitting behind the rest of the Social Democrats since being readmitted to the party.

news.title: Gaza hit by telecoms blackout as Israeli tanks advance amid intensifying invasion
news.summary: Israeli tanks were seen in two Gaza City areas that are gateways to the city centre, residents said on Thursday, while internet and phone lines were cut off across the Gaza Strip, a sign that ground operations were likely to escalate imminently.

news.title: ‘Can they come back? Yes, but it’s their biggest test to date’  – Ciarán Carey on whether Limerick can scale hurling summit again
news.summary: Ciarán Carey made a bold prediction in the summer of 2018 that Limerick would dominate the hurling landscape in a similar way that the all-conquering Dublin footballers did, but what does he think seven years later?

news.title: Ireland’s pharma sector is world class, but why don’t we have a Novo Nordisk to take our success to the next level?
news.summary: Denmark has Novo Nordisk, France has Sanofi, Switzerland boasts both Roche and Novartis, while Germany has Bayer. It’s a somewhat troubled relationship, but Britain has AstraZeneca.

news.title: Explainer: What did Jimmy Kimmel say about Charlie Kirk shooting that got his late night show pulled?
news.summary: Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night show has been pulled from schedules due to his comments about Charlie Kirk’s fatal shooting.

news.title: Colin Farrell leaves fans in hysterics with accidental f-bomb on live TV, while eating a Tayto sandwich
news.summary: Colin Farrell was left red-faced after he accidentally swore on live TV, much to the amusement of the Irish actor’s fans.

news.title: How to pay off your mortgage early and save thousands in interest – money experts share their tips
news.summary: A mortgage can feel like a never-ending loan, with many facing decades of payments.

news.title: Restaurant review: ‘This well-known cafe has navigated a recession and a pandemic – that’s down to good staff, good value and good ingredients’
news.summary: Whether longevity in a restaurant is something to be prized or feared is one of those perennial questions. If a place has been around for ever, does that mean it’s likely to be going through the motions and inclined to be stale? Or is it simply proof that it's good at what it does, that there’�s no need to fix what ain’t broken?
